member.summary: Returns the total amount of space within the underlying buffer.

member.summary: Returns the amount of space available that can still be written into without forcing the underlying buffer to grow.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.ArrayBufferWriter`1.Clear
member.summary: Clears the data written to the underlying buffer.
member.remarks: You must clear the before trying to re-use it.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.ArrayBufferWriter`1.Advance(System.Int32)
member.summary: Notifies that amount of data was written to the output /.
member.exception: Thrown when attempting to advance past the end of the underlying buffer.
member.remarks: You must request a new buffer after calling Advance to continue writing more data and cannot write to a previously acquired buffer.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.ArrayBufferWriter`1.GetMemory(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a to write to that is at least the requested length (specified by ). If no is provided (or it's equal to 0), some non-empty buffer is returned.
member.remarks: This will never return an empty .
There is no guarantee that successive calls will return the same buffer or the same-sized buffer.
You must request a new buffer after calling Advance to continue writing more data and cannot write to a previously acquired buffer.

member.remarks: This will never return an empty .
There is no guarantee that successive calls will return the same buffer or the same-sized buffer.
You must request a new buffer after calling Advance to continue writing more data and cannot write to a previously acquired buffer.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.AppContextSwitchHelper.GetConfigValue(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines if either an AppContext switch or its corresponding Environment Variable is set
member.param: Name of the AppContext switch.
Name of the Environment variable.
member.returns: If the AppContext switch has been set, returns the value of the switch. If the AppContext switch has not been set, returns the value of the environment variable. False if neither is set.

member.name: T:Azure.Core.AsyncLockWithValue`1
member.summary: Primitive that combines async lock and value cache

member.name: M:Azure.Core.AsyncLockWithValue`1.GetLockOrValueAsync(System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Method that either returns cached value or acquire a lock. If one caller has acquired a lock, other callers will be waiting for the lock to be released. If value is set, lock is released and all waiters get that value. If value isn't set, the next waiter in the queue will get the lock.

member.name: P:Azure.Core.AsyncLockWithValue`1.LockOrValue.HasValue
member.summary: Returns true if lock contains the cached value. Otherwise false.

member.name: P:Azure.Core.AsyncLockWithValue`1.LockOrValue.Value
member.summary: Returns cached value if it was set when lock has been created. Throws exception otherwise.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.AsyncLockWithValue`1.LockOrValue.SetValue(`0)
member.summary: Set value to the cache and to all the waiters.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.Pipeline.ClientDiagnostics.#ctor(Azure.Core.ClientOptions,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The customer provided client options object.

Flag controlling if created by this for client method calls should be suppressed when called by other Azure SDK client methods. It's recommended to set it to true for new clients; use default (null) for backward compatibility reasons, or set it to false to explicitly disable suppression for specific cases. The default value could change in the future, the flag should be only set to false if suppression for the client should never be enabled.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.Pipeline.ClientDiagnostics.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Azure.Core.DiagnosticsOptions,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Namespace of the client class, such as Azure.Storage or Azure.AppConfiguration.
Azure Resource Provider namespace of the Azure service SDK is primarily used for.
The customer provided client diagnostics options.

Flag controlling if created by this for client method calls should be suppressed when called by other Azure SDK client methods. It's recommended to set it to true for new clients, use default (null) for old clients for backward compatibility reasons, or set it to false to explicitly disable suppression for specific cases. The default value could change in the future, the flag should be only set to false if suppression for the client should never be enabled.

member.name: T:Azure.Core.Pipeline.TaskExtensions.Enumerable`1
member.summary: Both and are defined as public structs so that foreach can use duck typing to call and avoid heap memory allocation. Please don't delete this method and don't make these types private.

member.name: T:Azure.Core.FixedDelayWithNoJitterStrategy
member.summary: A delay strategy that uses a fixed delay with no jitter applied. This is used by data plane LROs.

member.name: T:Azure.Core.OperationInternal
member.summary:
A helper class used to build long-running operation instances. In order to use this helper:
Make sure your LRO implements the interface.
Add a private field to your LRO, and instantiate it during construction.
Delegate method calls to the implementations.
Supported members:
, used for

member.name: M:Azure.Core.OperationInternal.Succeeded(Azure.Response)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class in a final successful state.
member.param: The final value of .

member.name: M:Azure.Core.OperationInternal.Failed(Azure.Response,Azure.RequestFailedException)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class in a final failed state.
member.param: The final value of .
The exception that will be thrown by UpdateStatusAsync.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.OperationInternal.#ctor(Azure.Core.IOperation,Azure.Core.Pipeline.ClientDiagnostics,Azure.Response,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{System.String,System.String}},Azure.Core.DelayStrategy)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The long-running operation making use of this class. Passing "this" is expected.
Used for diagnostic scope and exception creation. This is expected to be the instance created during the construction of your main client.

The initial value of . Usually, long-running operation objects can be instantiated in two ways:
When calling a client's "Start<OperationName>" method, a service call is made to start the operation, and an instance is returned. In this case, the response received from this service call can be passed here.
When a user instantiates an directly using a public constructor, there's no previous service call. In this case, passing null is expected.
The type name of the long-running operation making use of this class. Used when creating diagnostic scopes. If left null, the type name will be inferred based on the parameter .
The attributes to use during diagnostic scope creation.
The delay strategy to use. Default is .

member.name: T:Azure.Core.IOperation
member.summary: An interface used by for making service calls and updating state. It's expected that your long-running operation classes implement this interface.

member.param: true if the call should be executed asynchronously. Otherwise, false.
A controlling the request lifetime.
member.returns:
A structure indicating the current operation state. The structure must be instantiated by one of its static methods:
Use when the operation has completed successfully.
Use when the operation has completed with failures.
Use when the operation has not completed yet.

member.name: T:Azure.Core.OperationState
member.summary:
A helper structure passed to to indicate the current operation state. This structure must be instantiated by one of its static methods, depending on the operation state:
Use when the operation has completed successfully.
Use when the operation has completed with failures.
Use when the operation has not completed yet.

member.returns: A new instance.

member.name: P:Azure.Core.OperationInternalBase.RawResponse
member.summary:
The last HTTP response received from the server. Its update already handled in calls to "UpdateStatus" and "WaitForCompletionAsync", but custom methods not supported by this class, such as "CancelOperation", must update it as well. Usage example:
public Response GetRawResponse() => _operationInternal.RawResponse;

member.name: P:Azure.Core.OperationInternalBase.HasCompleted
M:Azure.Core.OperationInternalBase.UpdateStatusAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Calls the server to get the latest status of the long-running operation, handling diagnostic scope creation for distributed tracing. The default scope name can be changed with the "operationTypeName" parameter passed to the constructor. Usage example:
public async ValueTask<Response> UpdateStatusAsync(CancellationToken cancellationToken) => await _operationInternal.UpdateStatusAsync(cancellationToken).ConfigureAwait(false);
member.param: A controlling the request lifetime.
member.returns: The HTTP response received from the server.
member.remarks: After a successful run, this method will update and might update .
member.exception: Thrown if there's been any issues during the connection, or if the operation has completed with failures.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.OperationInternalBase.UpdateStatus(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Calls the server to get the latest status of the long-running operation, handling diagnostic scope creation for distributed tracing. The default scope name can be changed with the "operationTypeName" parameter passed to the constructor. Usage example:
public Response UpdateStatus(CancellationToken cancellationToken) => _operationInternal.UpdateStatus(cancellationToken);
member.param: A controlling the request lifetime.
member.returns: The HTTP response received from the server.
member.remarks: After a successful run, this method will update and might update .
member.exception: Thrown if there's been any issues during the connection, or if the operation has completed with failures.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.OperationInternalBase.WaitForCompletionResponseAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Periodically calls until the long-running operation completes. After each service call, a retry-after header may be returned to communicate that there is no reason to poll for status change until the specified time has passed. The maximum of the retry after value and the fallback strategy is then used as the wait interval. Headers supported are: "Retry-After", "retry-after-ms", and "x-ms-retry-after-ms", Usage example:
public async ValueTask<Response<T>> WaitForCompletionAsync(CancellationToken cancellationToken) => await _operationInternal.WaitForCompletionAsync(cancellationToken).ConfigureAwait(false);
member.param: A controlling the request lifetime.
member.returns: The last HTTP response received from the server, including the final result of the long-running operation.
member.exception: Thrown if there's been any issues during the connection, or if the operation has completed with failures.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.OperationInternalBase.WaitForCompletionResponseAsync(System.TimeSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Periodically calls until the long-running operation completes. The interval between calls is defined by the parameter , but it can change based on information returned from the server. After each service call, a retry-after header may be returned to communicate that there is no reason to poll for status change until the specified time has passed. In this case, the maximum value between the parameter and the retry-after header is chosen as the wait interval. Headers supported are: "Retry-After", "retry-after-ms", and "x-ms-retry-after-ms". Usage example:
public async ValueTask<Response<T>> WaitForCompletionAsync(TimeSpan pollingInterval, CancellationToken cancellationToken) => await _operationInternal.WaitForCompletionAsync(pollingInterval, cancellationToken).ConfigureAwait(false);
member.param: The interval between status requests to the server.
A controlling the request lifetime.
member.returns: The last HTTP response received from the server, including the final result of the long-running operation.
member.exception: Thrown if there's been any issues during the connection, or if the operation has completed with failures.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.OperationInternalBase.WaitForCompletionResponse(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Periodically calls until the long-running operation completes. After each service call, a retry-after header may be returned to communicate that there is no reason to poll for status change until the specified time has passed. The maximum of the retry after value and the fallback strategy is then used as the wait interval. Headers supported are: "Retry-After", "retry-after-ms", and "x-ms-retry-after-ms", and "x-ms-retry-after-ms". Usage example:
public async ValueTask<Response<T>> WaitForCompletionAsync(TimeSpan pollingInterval, CancellationToken cancellationToken) => await _operationInternal.WaitForCompletionAsync(pollingInterval, cancellationToken).ConfigureAwait(false);
member.param: A controlling the request lifetime.
member.returns: The last HTTP response received from the server, including the final result of the long-running operation.
member.exception: Thrown if there's been any issues during the connection, or if the operation has completed with failures.

Periodically calls until the long-running operation completes. The interval between calls is defined by the parameter , but it can change based on information returned from the server. In this case, the maximum value between the parameter and the retry-after header is chosen as the wait interval. Headers supported are: "Retry-After", "retry-after-ms", and "x-ms-retry-after-ms". Usage example:
public async ValueTask<Response<T>> WaitForCompletionAsync(TimeSpan pollingInterval, CancellationToken cancellationToken) => await _operationInternal.WaitForCompletionAsync(pollingInterval, cancellationToken).ConfigureAwait(false);
member.param: The interval between status requests to the server.

member.name: P:Azure.Core.ProtocolOperation`1.Id
member.summary: Gets an ID representing the operation that can be used to poll for the status of the long-running operation.

member.name: P:Azure.Core.ProtocolOperation`1.Value
member.summary: Final result of the long-running operation.
member.remarks: This property can be accessed only after the operation completes successfully (HasValue is true).

member.name: P:Azure.Core.ProtocolOperation`1.HasCompleted
member.summary: Returns true if the long-running operation completed.

member.name: P:Azure.Core.ProtocolOperation`1.HasValue
member.summary: Returns true if the long-running operation completed successfully and has produced final result (accessible by Value property).

member.name: M:Azure.Core.ProtocolOperation`1.GetRawResponse
member.summary: The last HTTP response received from the server.
member.remarks: The last response returned from the server during the lifecycle of this instance. An instance of sends requests to a server in UpdateStatusAsync, UpdateStatus, and other methods. Responses from these requests can be accessed using GetRawResponse.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.ProtocolOperation`1.UpdateStatus(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Calls the server to get updated status of the long-running operation.
member.param: A used for the service call.
member.returns: The HTTP response received from the server.
member.remarks: This operation will update the value returned from GetRawResponse and might update HasCompleted.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.ProtocolOperation`1.UpdateStatusAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Calls the server to get updated status of the long-running operation.
member.param: A used for the service call.
member.returns: The HTTP response received from the server.
member.remarks: This operation will update the value returned from GetRawResponse and might update HasCompleted.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.ProtocolOperation`1.WaitForCompletionAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Periodically calls the server till the long-running operation completes.
member.param: A used for the periodical service calls.
member.returns: The last HTTP response received from the server.
member.remarks: This method will periodically call UpdateStatusAsync till HasCompleted is true, then return the final result of the operation.

member.name: M:Azure.Core.ProtocolOperation`1.WaitForCompletionAsync(System.TimeSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Periodically calls the server till the long-running operation completes.
member.param: The interval between status requests to the server. The interval can change based on information returned from the server. For example, the server might communicate to the client that there is not reason to poll for status change sooner than some time.
A used for the periodical service calls.
member.returns: The last HTTP response received from the server.
member.remarks: This method will periodically call UpdateStatusAsync till HasCompleted is true, then return the final result of the operation.

member.name: T:Azure.Core.SequentialDelayStrategy
member.summary: A delay strategy that uses a fixed sequence of delays with no jitter applied. This is used by management LROs.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresDynamicCodeAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the specified method requires the ability to generate new code at runtime, for example through .
member.remarks: This allows tools to understand which methods are unsafe to call when compiling ahead of time.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresDynamicCodeAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified message.
member.param: A message that contains information about the usage of dynamic code.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresDynamicCodeAttribute.Message
member.summary: Gets a message that contains information about the usage of dynamic code.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresDynamicCodeAttribute.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional URL that contains more information about the method, why it requires dynamic code, and what options a consumer has to deal with it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresUnreferencedCodeAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the specified method requires dynamic access to code that is not referenced statically, for example through .
member.remarks: This allows tools to understand which methods are unsafe to call when removing unreferenced code from an application.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresUnreferencedCodeAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified message.
member.param: A message that contains information about the usage of unreferenced code.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresUnreferencedCodeAttribute.Message
member.summary: Gets a message that contains information about the usage of unreferenced code.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresUnreferencedCodeAttribute.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional URL that contains more information about the method, why it requires unreferenced code, and what options a consumer has to deal with it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute
member.summary: Suppresses reporting of a specific rule violation, allowing multiple suppressions on a single code artifact.
member.remarks: is different than in that it doesn't have a . So it is always preserved in the compiled assembly.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying the category of the tool and the identifier for an analysis rule.
member.param: The category for the attribute.
The identifier of the analysis rule the attribute applies to.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Category
member.summary: Gets the category identifying the classification of the attribute.
member.remarks: The property describes the tool or tool analysis category for which a message suppression attribute applies.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.CheckId
member.summary: Gets the identifier of the analysis tool rule to be suppressed.
member.remarks: Concatenated together, the and properties form a unique check identifier.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Scope
member.summary: Gets or sets the scope of the code that is relevant for the attribute.
member.remarks: The Scope property is an optional argument that specifies the metadata scope for which the attribute is relevant.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets a fully qualified path that represents the target of the attribute.
member.remarks: The property is an optional argument identifying the analysis target of the attribute. An example value is "System.IO.Stream.ctor():System.Void". Because it is fully qualified, it can be long, particularly for targets such as parameters. The analysis tool user interface should be capable of automatically formatting the parameter.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.MessageId
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional argument expanding on exclusion criteria.
member.remarks: The property is an optional argument that specifies additional exclusion where the literal metadata target is not sufficiently precise. For example, the cannot be applied within a method, and it may be desirable to suppress a violation against a statement in the method that will give a rule violation, but not against all statements in the method.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Justification
member.summary: Gets or sets the justification for suppressing the code analysis message.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicDependencyAttribute
member.summary: States a dependency that one member has on another.
member.remarks: This can be used to inform tooling of a dependency that is otherwise not evident purely from metadata and IL, for example a member relied on via reflection.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicDependencyAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified signature of a member on the same type as the consumer.
member.param: The signature of the member depended on.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicDependencyAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified signature of a member on a .
member.param: The signature of the member depended on.
The containing .

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicDependencyAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified signature of a member on a type in an assembly.
member.param: The signature of the member depended on.
The full name of the type containing the specified member.
The assembly name of the type containing the specified member.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicDependencyAttribute.#ctor(System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes,System.Type)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified types of members on a .
member.param: The types of members depended on.
The containing the specified members.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicDependencyAttribute.#ctor(System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified types of members on a type in an assembly.
member.param: The types of members depended on.
The full name of the type containing the specified members.
The assembly name of the type containing the specified members.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicDependencyAttribute.MemberSignature
member.summary: Gets the signature of the member depended on.
member.remarks: Either must be a valid string or must not equal , but not both.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicDependencyAttribute.MemberTypes
member.summary: Gets the which specifies the type of members depended on.
member.remarks: Either must be a valid string or must not equal , but not both.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicDependencyAttribute.Type
member.summary: Gets the containing the specified member.
member.remarks: If neither nor are specified, the type of the consumer is assumed.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicDependencyAttribute.TypeName
member.summary: Gets the full name of the type containing the specified member.
member.remarks: If neither nor are specified, the type of the consumer is assumed.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicDependencyAttribute.AssemblyName
member.summary: Gets the assembly name of the specified type.
member.remarks: is only valid when is specified.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicDependencyAttribute.Condition
member.summary: Gets or sets the condition in which the dependency is applicable, e.g. "DEBUG".

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMembersAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that certain members on a specified are accessed dynamically, for example through .
member.remarks:
This allows tools to understand which members are being accessed during the execution of a program.
This attribute is valid on members whose type is or .
When this attribute is applied to a location of type , the assumption is that the string represents a fully qualified type name.
When this attribute is applied to a class, interface, or struct, the members specified can be accessed dynamically on instances returned from calling on instances of that class, interface, or struct.
If the attribute is applied to a method it's treated as a special case and it implies the attribute should be applied to the "this" parameter of the method. As such the attribute should only be used on instance methods of types assignable to System.Type (or string, but no methods will use it there).

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMembersAttribute.#ctor(System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified member types.
member.param: The types of members dynamically accessed.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMembersAttribute.MemberTypes
member.summary: Gets the which specifies the type of members dynamically accessed.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes
member.summary:
Specifies the types of members that are dynamically accessed.
This enumeration has a attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes.None
member.summary: Specifies no members.

member.summary: Specifies the default, parameterless public constructor.

member.summary: Specifies all public constructors.

member.summary: Specifies all public nested types.

member.summary: Specifies all non-public nested types.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes.PublicProperties

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes.NonPublicProperties

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes.Interfaces
member.summary: Specifies all interfaces implemented by the type.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes.All
member.summary: Specifies all members.
